description.narrative:
The developmental impact is expected to be high:
- The Project would provide funding for underserved segments of society in an IDA country, more specifically women entrepreneurs, and will contribute to employment creation and poverty reduction in Kyrgyz Republic.
- The Project would support the efforts of FMCC to diversify and increase the volume of their funding and to better manage their asset and liability position at a time of limited funding opportunities.
- In Kyrgyz Republic, the provision of term funding in the local financial market will have a very strong demonstration effect and build market confidence. This is extremely relevant in a post conflict environment.

The proposed project is to provide a $6 million senior loan (or local currency equivalent) to FINCA MicroCredit Company (FMCC or the Company), a leading microfinance company in Kyrgyz Republic. Proceeds of the loan will be used to finance the expansion of their lending to micro and small entrepreneurs (the Project). The Company currently seeks long-term funding to continue its dynamic growth and offer new products to its target clientele.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Makhmud Saidakhmatov Country Director CJSC FINCA MicroCredit Company 93/2 Shopokov Street, Bishkek, Kyrgyz Republic, 720021 Tel.: +996 312 440440 Fax: +996 312 440440 E-mail: makhmud.saidakhmatov@finca.org www.finca.org

name.narrative: FMCC is headquartered in Bishkek, Kyrgyz Republic. It is currently present in all seven regions of the country and runs a network of 18 branches and 51 outlets thus having a nation-wide coverage.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

sector.narrative: HA - Microfinance and Small Business - Non Commercial Banking
